channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: The Australian actor will play the late royal in the fifth and sixth seasons of the show.
item.title: Australian actor Elizabeth Debicki to play Princess Diana in The Crown

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: Victoria reported 279 new coronavirus cases on Sunday, as its state of emergency was extended.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 282 new COVID-19 cases as state of emergency extended; NZ election delayed as Australian death toll jumps to 421

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: JB Hi-Fi has reported a record set of full-year earnings and says sales have continued to surge through July and August.
item.title: JB Hi-Fi sales surge as retailer reports record year

item.dc:creator: Kate Lahey
item.description: Another 25 people have died of coronavirus in Victoria in the past day, and the state has recorded 282 new cases.
item.title: Victoria records 25 coronavirus deaths, 282 new cases

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: The Prime Minister says the decision was taken after consultation with other political parties and to provide certainty to voters.
item.title: Jacinda Ardern delays NZ election by four weeks as virus worsens

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Australia's biggest steelmaker, BlueScope, has reported a 91 per cent fall in its full year statutory net profit to $96.5 million.
item.title: Bluescope Steel profit plunges 91pc, writes down NZ arm

item.description: Valentino Rossi looked visibly shaken when he returned to the garage before the resumption of the Austrian MotoGP after two flying bikes missed him by inches.
item.title: Rossi urges riders to control aggression after 'terrifying' crash

item.description: The controversial hiring of Nicolai Tangen to run Norway's $1.1 trillion wealth fund has reignited a debate over who controls the world's largest sovereign investor.
item.title: World's biggest wealth fund's embarrassing recruitment debacle

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 16, 2020

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 17, 2020

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: Catel wants to create an online marketplace, but instead of securities in companies, people can invest in tangible farm products, such as a hectare of grain or a barn of chickens.
item.title: WA country kids set sights on creating the 'ASX of agriculture'

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: “There is some complacency, people think it’s over. We don't think it is," a WA Department of Education executive has revealed as New Zealand struggles to contain an unexpected cluster of cases.
item.title: Living on borrowed time: Is it inevitable WA's COVID-free bubble will burst?

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Collingwood have also announced they had retained their two Irish recruits Sarah Rowe and Aishling Sheridan.
item.title: Pies re-sign Layton and Bonnici for AFLW 2021

item.description: The world No.4 will skip a lead-up tournament in Cincinnati while women's world No.2 Simona Halep is set to make her US Open decision imminently.
item.title: Nishikori tests positive for COVID-19 two weeks out from US Open

item.description: Nic Walker visits the Snowy Mountains and is met with a winter white and bushfire black. Early this year the Adaminaby Complex Fire and the Dunns Road fire devastated the ecosystems and communites in the Australian Alps.
item.title: Winter wonderland aids bushfire recovery

item.description: England's dismal European campaign came to an end with Sevilla through to another Europa League final at the expense of Manchester United.
item.title: De Jong sends Sevilla past Man United into Europa League final

item.description: Militants detonated a car bomb in front of an upscale hotel in the Somali capital, then entered the beachside property. State security forces engaged in a four-hour standoff before killing two attackers.
item.title: Gunmen storm beachside hotel in Somali capital, killing more than 10 people

item.description: Chetan Chauhan, who played for India from 1969 to 1981, partnered Sunil Gavaskar at the top of the order and was known for his patience and determination.
item.title: Former India opener Chauhan dies after COVID-19 complications

item.description: A little over an hour's play was possible at the start of the day before rain forced the players off with England 1-7 and the match meandering towards a draw.
item.title: Burns falls for England as rain plays havoc with second Test

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Emergency services rushed to Rifle Range Road in Upper Coomera, where the driver and a passenger of one car were pronounced dead at the scene.
item.title: Three killed in overnight Gold Coast crash take weekend toll to five

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Police discovered 52-year-old Anthony Brady's body in a Cairns hotel on Friday, one day after he was due back in Brisbane from a business trip.
item.title: Woman to front court after Brisbane man found dead in Cairns

item.description: President Alexander Lukashenko - often called Europe's last dictator - accuses NATO of massing on his country's western border and turns to Vladimir Putin for support
item.title: 'Rats, trash and bandits': Tens of thousands rally in largest protest in Belarus history

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: The NSW government's workers' compensation giant has overpaid millions on medical fees, including for a caesarean anesthetic for a male patient.
item.title: Systemic failures costing icare billions of dollars

item.description: Infections in a number of school districts have forced officials to reverse plans to bring students back for the new academic year.
item.title: Coronavirus infections are on the rise among children in the US: CDC

item.description: More than 10,000 protesters rallied in Bangkok on Sunday in by far the biggest anti-government demonstration since a 2014 coup.
item.title: 'Down with dictatorship': Protesters take to the streets of Bangkok

item.description: The Mercedes driver moves within three wins of Michael Schumacher's Formula One record.
item.title: Lewis Hamilton seals Spanish Grand Prix title for 88th career win

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: The Victorian Liberal Party is investigating branch-stacking allegations after an internal audit found some members breached party rules by paying for other people's membership fees.
item.title: Liberal Party investigates branch-stacking claims

item.description: The Ruby Princess inquiry report has spared our political leaders from outright blame over the debacle. But in the court of public opinion, the jury is still out.
item.title: Questions linger despite Ruby Princess findings

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: Scamwatch has received 24,000 reports of stolen personal information this year, a 55 per cent rise compared with the same time last year.
item.title: 'That's my job': Scammers costing Australians millions a year

item.dc:creator: Megan Gorrey
item.description: The policy came into effect in February, after Greens' politicians warned previous moves to weaken protections for trees could trigger a "tree massacre".
item.title: Tree removals surge in Sydney's inner west under council clearing policy

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Expanded mental health clinics will be established across Melbourne and regional centres to support Victorians amid the coronavirus-induced recession, tough social isolation measures and rising unemployment.
item.title: More cash to boost Victorian mental health services as lockdown takes toll

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: The broadcaster is a member of the same family as the Penrith winger, who was the subject of racist taunts from crowd members during an NRL game on Friday night.
item.title: 'Racism is its own virus': Stan Grant hails Brent Naden's courage in standing up to abuse

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: Australia's chief anti-gambling organisation believes both players and teams should have the option to remove themselves from same-game multi-markets.
item.title: Anti-gambling body wants players to have option to withdraw from same-game multis

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Health experts have called on governments to do more than pay lip service to the Black Lives Matter movement by working to improve the health of Indigenous Australians.
item.title: Experts call for health overhaul to fight 'ongoing pandemic of racism'

item.dc:creator: Megan Gorrey
item.description: Sydney's pressing need for more affordable homes and the prospect of rebuilding the estate alongside a new train station put Waterloo firmly in the sights of the government in 2015.
item.title: Sydney's biggest social experiment: The plan to turn Waterloo into a 'world-class precinct'

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: Recipients typically spent an extra $3618 during the first fortnight after receiving the lump sum compared with the same people’s average spending in a normal fortnight.
item.title: Second stage of super withdrawals boosts non-essential spending

item.dc:creator: Kate McClymont
item.description: Despite a number of negligence actions which have been launched over allegations of his botched breast surgeries, the doctor has never turned up for a hearing.
item.title: Botched surgeries, unpaid bills: The case of the disappearing doctor

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Virgin Australia's owner-in-waiting Bain Capital faces a fracturing relationship with one of the airline's key unions which threatens next month's creditors vote on the airline's future.
item.title: Virgin workers dispute reignites ahead of key vote hearing

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk has made one of her first major plays ahead of October's poll, announcing a celebrity candidate in the LNP-held Gold Coast.
item.title: 'Faux campaigning': Labor goes coastal as COVID-19 election shapes up

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: oOh! Media has asked staff to consider taking a pay cut until the end of the year as the billboard company tries to cope with low demand from advertisers.
item.title: oOh! Media asks staff to volunteer for pay cut extension

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: The CEO of the nation's biggest utility and the largest emitter of carbon dioxide, AGL, is smack dab in the middle of a fierce debate over how to move from fossil fuels to renewables.
item.title: AGL boss Brett Redman walks the tightrope on energy transition

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW Health Minister Brad Hazzard is throwing his support behind public health officials.
item.title: Hazzard backs NSW Health officials after damning inquiry report

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: Neither side of politics wants to admit it, but the economy’s recovery from the coronacession will be weak and slow until we get back to strong growth in wages.
item.title: Tribal prejudices about wages guarantee a weak recovery

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Australia's peak export body says the federal government's multi-million dollar air freight subsidies program will need to be extended well into the new year.
item.title: Questions over exports as air cargo volumes nosedive

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: A production company hosted Scott Morrison at its Gold Coast studio to promote a $400 million arts package. This week it found out it was ineligible for assistance.
item.title: 'Left for dead': Prime Minister accused of using company as a prop

item.description: The ASX 200 will start the week juggling a slew of international and local concerns as investors keep a close eye on the next set of company results.
item.title: Blue-chip results, stimulus to dominate investor sentiment

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: The Liverpool great is claiming wrongful dismissal from A-League club Brisbane Roar, which has insisted he departed in June by mutual agreement.
item.title: Revealed: Letter that shows Fowler's deal was terminated 'without notice'

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: A federal department has joined NSW agencies criticising the state government's plan to raise Warragamba Dam's wall, saying it failed to conduct surveys of the likely impacts on wildlife including after last summer's bushfires.
item.title: 'Unacceptable': Federal department blasts Warragamba Dam wall plan

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Google Australia has delayed plans to license content from publishers as it prepares to fight the competition regulator over its code of conduct.
item.title: Google delays local licensing deal, prepares for ACCC fight
